Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cohiba....good for parties”
Reviews.Author: Maria L
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of the party zone, 2 min away from the beach, 3 min away from 5th Ave, very clean, small mediterranean boutique hotel, with a terrace upstairs that overlooks all the clubs on 12th Street....it has a large suite room on the last floor, private, terrace overlooks the beach, the rooms have good furniture, A/C, T.V., hot and cold water, room service including towels and other, laundry service, restaurant service next door, friendly guest service, good for parties and people who want to party, music is loud in the area, its a party zone, continental breakfast and beach club access included in the price, ask for special rates depending on season!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: yogevhen
Reviews.Content: The hotel located in the clubs area and very close to the beach, the purpose of my trip were beaches and parties - so it was perfect for me! The employees were very very kind and help me. The room was very clean and high-level, the service was perfect. I can definitely recommend this hotel!(: Yogev, Israel

Reviews.Title: “LOUD DISCO MUSIC”
Reviews.Author: ddangerous
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right smack dab in the middle of the disco, club area. There is loud techno music from several clubs from 4:00 pm to 4:00 am. Even my 25 years old daughter thought it was too much. The club scene was fun but stay a few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but loud”
Reviews.Author: Jainraisig
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cohiba was a clean stay but with a few disappointments. The TV didn't work, there were a few bugs in the bathroom (it is Mexico but its also >$70 a night). My major disappointment was that it was so loud. I can party but loud club music thumping into the room until at least 3 am was a bit much. Everyone was nice and helpful but not necessarily effective. The location is quite central, one block from 5th avenue, the main food/shopping/clubbing street of Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BufalaPezzata
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the middle of Playa's nightlife area, so don't go there if you want quiet nights, as music is blasting loud from the nearby clubs until 4AM. I took the "lounge" room, right at the top, with seaview terrace. The decor is lovely, rustic, there are no windows in this big room though. There was a kitchenette, but I had to ask for a fridge, which was taken from another room, the aircon wasn't that effective in cooling the room, probably because the palapa roof isn't providing insulation. The bathroom door kept jamming and required brutal force to be opened. The worst thing was the stench in the bathroom: a permanent smell of sewage coming from the pipes: yuk! Continental breakfast was quite a joke: a thermos of watery coffee and 2 slices of bread with strawberry jam or... strawberry jam. No juice, no fruit, nothing else than bread and coffee. There's free internet, but it's not accessible from the rooms, only from the lobby and the restaurant. The staff was lovely, the room clean, location just perfect if you go to Playa to enjoy the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the housekeeping made us beautiful towel swans each day. The front desk staff were friendly and we were close to the center of town with easy access to many restaurants and attractions. However, the bar/restaurant downstairs that is attached to the hotel plays very loud music until late each night, which even the sound of your air conditioner will not completely drown out if you are on the second floor. Also, it seems the hotel could take some fairly easy and inexpensive steps to greatly improve security. For example, our room had a security bar on the door but our room key didn't work on it. When we asked for the key, the staff told us that "another guest had lost it and they didn't have another one." Likewise, the "security box" in our room had no key or even keyhole, so we couldn't use it. It also appeared that someone could slide open the windows to our room in the hallway without much difficulty and get into the room. However, we had no problems with break-ins while we were there. The view we had was of a brick wall, but the higher-floor rooms may be better. The windows were frosted so the lack of view didn't really affect the aesthetic quality of the room, which looked tranquil and pretty. There was a TV and air conditioner in the room and a nice window-seat area for reading. The shower was spacious and there was always plenty of hot water. For $55 a night, it was a farily good value, but we probably wouldn't stay there again due to the noise issues and lack of security.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Cohiba!”
Reviews.Author: Bigskychick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cohiba for my 35th birthday......and had a great time. The breakfast was fruit & pastries at the hotel next door, it really wasn't worth my time.......but most "continental" breakfasts aren't! We had a fridge in our room, and the air conditioning worked great! Our balcony rocked!!! on our final night there, they upgraded us to room #20 (or was it 21) the "top" floor suite! It had an amazing patio, with views of Cozumel, a kitchen, a huge palapa roof, a huge bathroom with a bidet, a hammock...........it was amazing!! The location was perfect! I would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after running thru all of the town looking for a hotel that we (mother, sister, and boyfriend) could all be happy with, we accidently stumbled into hotel cohiba. thank god. i was more than pleased with the location. the decor was very simple and tasteful. the staff was very friendly and eager to accomodate with any thing you might need. of course there were little things that could have been better. but no where is going to be perfect. the other treat of the place is the restautant (kartabar) in the lobby. amazing food and delicious wine. a very stylish yet comfortable environment. i will definetly return to playa del carmen and when i do i will stay at hotel cohiba.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cohiba preys on travellers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service from the start was terrible. My girlfriend had paid for our reservation in advance, yet when i arrived at the hotel i was told that I had to wait since the guests from the night before hadn't checked out - it was 3pm when this occured. they offered me a downgrade room as they best that they could do. i accepted because i was tired and frustrated. Second, they accepted my credit card and payment (i forgot that we had already paid for the room) and didn't notify me that the room had already been booked and paid for. I am currently attempting to get a refund for the additional amount I had paid and haven't received it as of yet, despite numerous assurances that it was happening.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient , friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cohiba in early Feb. 2003 for six nights. The staff was extremely helpful with directions, advice on attractions and eating suggestions. The rooms and public areas were immaculate, though a little dated. The staff (Julio) arranged a boat charter for snorkeling and fishing (caught two huge red snapper) and the boat captain took our fish to a restaurant just off the beach where we consumed it(well, part of it) for lunch. We found a bed light to be inoperative but it was rewired within the hour. We'll return next winter.

Reviews.Title: “Not Safe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a great location and is nice but the room that we were staying was broke into and the safe deposit box was stolen. But the door was locked when we returned to our room to find that it had been broken into. So this leaves me with one conclusion, it was an employee of the hotel. To make matters worse, we talked to the owner of the hotel, and he would do nothing for us and did not even apologize, but he sure did try to charge us $300.00 dollars for the safe deposit box that was stolen! I would not recommend to stay there, it's not safe.
